intro: Droguetia urticoides, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, often stinging leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically green or yellowish. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its stinging hairs, it can be potentially irritating to the skin upon contact.
